snippet: Mohamed Musallam was seen in a video released Tuesday by the Islamic State. Before he was shot in the head by a boy, he admitted under obvious duress that he was “an agent for the Israeli Mossad.”
abstract: Family of Mohamed Musallam, Palestinian from East Jerusalem who appears in video released by Islamic State claiming under duress to be spy for Israel before being shot, insists that Musallam was not involved in espionage; accusations of colluding with Israel are worse for some Palestinians than charges of joining ISIS.

byline.contributor: Irit Pazner Garshowitz and Alissa J. Rubin contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Mohamed Musallam was seen in a video released Tuesday by the Islamic State. Before he was shot in the head by a boy, he admitted under obvious duress that he was “an agent for the Israeli Mossad.”

headline.main: Family Denies Palestinian Killed by ISIS Was Spy
headline.print_headline: Family Denies Palestinian Killed by ISIS Was Spy

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
